result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angel Luis Reyes-Burgos

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Angel Luis Reyes-Burgos in court.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Angel Luis Reyes-Burgos.  Attorney Alexandria S Carlson for Kimberly Dorice Schoepp in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense received discovery and pretrial offer; defense requested more time to review with defendant and requested plea hearing date. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 36. Plea hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (15 pages) commencing 07-28-22 by AMY DE LA ROSA.

Defendant Angel Luis Reyes-Burgos in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Morales-Colon. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.    
All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 316 Safety Bldg.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Supervision Report 07-28-2022

Defendant Angel Luis Reyes-Burgos in court, appear by video.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has no appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied.Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Angel Luis Reyes-Burgos in court, appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AD, RD, TK, CS.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT LEVEL 3 for supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT immediately upon leaving court.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug test and portable breathalyzers. 
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Angel Luis Reyes-Burgos in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/03/2022@01:00pm
